title: JSON schema for AncientMetagenomeDir ancient host-associated single-genome data
description: The JSON schema for AncientMetagenomeDir ancient host-associated single genome data

items.title: The items schema
items.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

project_name.title: AncientMetagenomeDir key of the publication
project_name.description: Format: surnameYYYY (if duplicate key but different publication, add b,c,d etc. as necessary). Must match a AncientMetagenomeDir samples table entry

publication_doi.title: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of the publication.
publication_doi.description: A valid DOI code (not as an URL). Must match a AncientMetagenomeDir samples table entry

sample_name.title: Name of the sample
sample_name.description: In most cases this should be the name of the host individual. Must match a AncientMetagenomeDir samples table entry

archive.title: Archiving platform
archive.description: Name of the nucleotide data archiving platform

archive_project.title: Archive project accession platform
archive_project.description: Name of the nucleotide data archiving platform. Must match a AncientMetagenomeDir samples table entry

archive_sample_accession.title: Archive accession number
archive_sample_accession.description: Samples archive accession numbers, multiple records can be separated with commas. No spaces allowed. . Must match a AncientMetagenomeDir samples table entry

sequencing_center.title: Extraction or sequencing lab name
sequencing_center.description: Name of sequencing center, institution or lab that generated the data
examples: Max Planck Institute for the Science of Human History
Section for Evolutionary Genomics, The GLOBE Institute

library_name.title: Name of the sequencing library
library_name.description: Name of the sequencing library generated from the sample. Typically matches the corresponding FASTQ file name

strand_type.title: Strandedness of library
strand_type.description: Strandedness of the DNA in the library, i.e. whether single or double stranded.

library_polymerase.title: Polymerases used during library construction, indexing and amplification.
library_polymerase.description: Comma separated list of polymerases used across all stages of library construction. Check against: https://spaam-community.github.io/AncientMetagenomeDir/assets/enums/library_polymerase.json. This can indicate whether damaged nucleotides are expected to be visible.

library_treatment.title: Name of damage-removal treatment
library_treatment.description: Name of any established damage-removal treatment that may have been performed.

instrument_model.title: Model of sequencing machine
instrument_model.description: Model of sequencing machine based on ENA controlled vocabulary (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/portal/api/controlledVocab?field=instrument_model

library_layout.title: Sequencing layout of library
library_layout.description: Sequencing layout of library, i.e. either single or paired end, based on ENA controlled vocabulary (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/portal/api/controlledVocab?field=library_layout

sequencing_cycles.title: Number of sequencing cycles
sequencing_cycles.description: Number of sequencing cycles used, i.e. sequencing kit specification of maximum length of reading one strand

library_strategy.title: Type of sequencing library
library_strategy.description: Type of sequencing library. Whether shotgun sequenced (WGS) or enriched using 'Target-Capture' protocols and similar.

read_count.title: Number of reads or pairs in library
read_count.description: Number of reads or pairs in library, i.e. how deep sequenced. For paired end, count pairs (should be same number for both directions)

archive_run_accession.title: Archive run accession number
archive_run_accession.description: Run archive accession numbers, single run accession per line. TODO: improve regex

file_type.title: Downloadable data type
file_type.description: Contents of downloadable file. I.e., all, mapped only etc.

download_links.title: Download link to raw data files
download_links.description: Download link to raw data files. Can be comma separated list for paired end. Link must allow direct download of files via command-line utility e.g. with wget or curl. TODO: improve regex

download_md5.title: MD5 checksums of downloads
download_md5.description: MD5 checksums of corresponding download files, to allow data integrity. Can be semi-colon separated list for paired end. TODO: improve regex

download_sizes.title: File sizes of downloads
download_sizes.description: File sizes of corresponding download files in bytes, to allow calculation of HDD usage. Can be semi-colon separated list for paired end. TODO: improve regex
